newsitem.title: USA: Verity Inc sees Q3 loss on merger costs.
newsitem.headline: Verity Inc sees Q3 loss on merger costs.

text.p: Verity Inc said late Thursday that it expects to report a third quarter loss of about $10.8 million, or $1.00 per share.
The figure includes write-off expenses related to its January merger with Cognisoft Corp of about $10.0 million, or $0.93 per share, the company said.
Wall Street had been expecting Verity to report a loss of $0.01 per share for the third fiscal quarter ended February 28, according to First Call consensus estimates.
The company said additionally it expects operating expenses for the third quarter to have increased from the previous quarter, primarily because of write-offs for the Cognisoft merger.
The third quarter loss before the write-offs should be about $800,000, or $0.07 per share, the company said.
For the year-ago third quarter, the company reported a net loss of $112,000, or $0.01 per share.

It said it is expects a nine-month net loss of about $1.9 million, or $0.17 per share, before Cognisoft write-offs, compared with a net loss of $1.3 million, or $0.18 per share, in the prior fiscal year's nine-month period.
Verity makes and markets software tools for searching, retrieving and filtering information on the Internet and CD-ROMs.
It said it will release its financial results March 19.
